ohh thats easy!

If you want an object search for public void NewObjects() { and you;ll see this

// magic stall makeGlobalObject(2373, 3433, 4877, 0, 10); // general stall makeGlobalObject(2373, 3434, 4878, 0, 10); // scimitar stall makeGlobalObject(2373, 3435, 2562, -1, 10); // gem stall makeGlobalObject(2373, 3437, 2565, -1, 10); // silver stall makeGlobalObject(2373, 3439, 2560, -1, 10); // silk stall makeGlobalObject(2375, 3441, 9398, -1, 10);//bank booth makeGlobalObject(2376, 3442, 2783, 0, 10); // anvil makeGlobalObject(2378, 3442, 2783, 0, 10); // anvil makeGlobalObject(2378, 3438, 2287, -1, 10);// Obstacle Pipe makeGlobalObject(2380, 3440, 2193, 0, 10);// Chest makeGlobalObject(2381, 3438, 4172, -1, 10); // Range makeGlobalObject(2377, 3434, 2480, -2, 10); // alter makeGlobalObject(2382, 3434, 1315, 0, 10); // evergreen makeGlobalObject(2382, 3432, 1307, 0, 10); // maple makeGlobalObject(2382, 3430, 1306, 0, 10); // magic makeGlobalObject(2381, 3425, 2213, 0, 10); // bank makeGlobalObject(2380, 3425, 2213, 0, 10); // bank }
Now add your item at the end
1st four numbers, X coords, 2nd four #'s, Y coords, 3rd four numbers, Object ID, then leave the 0 and 10 alone.

Now lets say you wanted to make an object appear, not a Object, open ItemSpawnPoints.java and
youll see somehting like this

ItemHandler.addItem(2414, 3118, 9848, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // Zammy Cape ItemHandler.addItem(2412, 3119, 9848, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // Sara Cape ItemHandler.addItem(2413, 3120, 9848, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // Guthix Cape ItemHandler.addItem(1945, 2626, 3272, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // Dino ItemHandler.addItem(1945, 2599, 3266, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // Dino ItemHandler.addItem(1945, 2609, 3281, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // Dino ItemHandler.addItem(1945, 2619, 3275, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // Dino ItemHandler.addItem(1945, 2615, 3269, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // Dino spawntimer = 50; } } }
At the end pf that list before the spawntimer add this line

ItemHandler.addItem(Item ID, X, Y, 1, ItemHandler.globalItemController[i], false); // Description

Then change spawntime to the number of seconds per drop, save and compile.
Post any errors or problems!!! thanks!

Read full topic

config/objects.cfg:file not found

Also would it make a difference if the file is named drops.cfg instead of globaldrops.cfg?

item.title: How to make an item spawn?
item.dc:creator: @krandolv krandolv
item.description:
@krandolv wrote:

type

 ::pickup itemID Amount

change ItemID to the… ID of the item
and change amount to…the amount of the item you want if you need the item ID’s post and ill take my time to give you a link

EDIT::
ok i noticed that your a senior member so instead of making an ass out of myself if you know that
all you gotta do is change your globaldrops.cfg file
